WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: A.B. GUS. TANTALON, SASK...
Address: TANTALON, SASK...
Birthplace: FINLAND...

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Eastern Canada? 1890 (July)
Where did you set up housekeeping? NEILSTON, SASK...
Where had you been living before that? VAREE, FINLAND...
For how many people did you prepare meals? MOTHER, FATHER, WIFE, SON, DAUGHTER, SIX...
How far was it to your nearest store? 2.5 MILES...
How often could a visit be made to the store? WHEN NEEDED...
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? SUGAR, TEA...

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? H.A. FLAX...
In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lb. BAGS...
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? 75¢...
How much did you use graham flour? N/A...
Whole wheat flour? HOMEMADE MILLSTONE...
Was flour milled locally? NO... How far away? THAT YEAR?
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? NEVER BOUGHT NONE...
What other grain products did you use? CORNMEAL...
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? YES...
How did you grind it? HOMEMADE MILLSTONE...
Lauttamus, Gus
Tantallon, 1890
